item.title: Excessively long grass and weeds, Still not cut. DESPITE BEING REPORTED AS FIXED, 21st June
item.description:
Repeat request. Original request (web ref 7595888 & enquiry no. 22078665) was acknowledged 20/6/25 .." Excessively long grass and weeds". Excessively long grass and weeds, limiting visibility, in a busy parking area. It is near the School, so a particular problem for school-children drop-off &pick-up. Others have reported to Tewkesbury BC, and been informed that Glos CC Highways now has grass-cutting responsibility for this area. Could you confirm this, and when it is likely to be cut. Concerned residents can then be informed. Thank you.." It is very evident that this has not been fixed as the grass has not been cut. Could you please provide a more considered (not automated) response, thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gretton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 signs advising Rd Rd closure 5 miles away in Winchcombe, 21st June
item.description:
25 yds on Southam Rd (B,4632) after turning off High St Prestbury. 3 signs referred to above blocks the lane. Being such a short distance from turn, this has serious potential to cause an accident. A similar sign a short distance away and another at the turning for Woodmancote giving 4 miles are surely adequate and are more safety located off the carriage way. These signs are placed at random times moreso in evenings
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: One side of Everest Road and pavement closed for storage, 21st June
item.description:
The first few metres of one side Everest road as you turn off Old Bath Road has been closed now for weeks. It is very dangerous as it creates a blind corner on a busy cut through from Charlton Kings to Leckhampton. There are no actual works going on here. Wales and West are using this as a storage facility. Why can't this be moved somewhere safer? There are plenty of cul de sacs off the Old Bath Road. This has been poorly thought through. as a resident I have witnessed some very dangerous driving, especially at school pick up and drop off times caused by impatience and the inconvenience this unnecessary blockage is creating.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Charnwood Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sequence wrong on one of the temporary traffic lights, 20th June
item.description:
The temporary traffic light is showing green too early for those coming into Cheltenham on the A46. The lights go green for those on Kidnappers Lane, and as you're driving down the road (as one of the first cars) you can see that it's already green for those on the A46. I've seen this 3 times, and it always seems to be that the A46 is going green too soon for those heading north.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Foot path closed on bridge causing danger, 20th June
item.description:
Bridge on Arle road north side footpath is blocked by barriers. People are supposed to cross but the road here is very dangerous as speeding cars coming over bridge cannot see people crossing the other side, from either direction . The barriers have also been knocked down and strewn around. People need to be aware to cross much further away. from the bridge. Seems poorly thought through
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridlepath has been deliberately blocked with wood and branches, 20th June
item.description:
Where the bridlepath exits the Witcombe park field and enters the wood beside the Buckholt Road the route of the bridlepath has been blocked with piles of branches and wood, clearly deliberately. The only way to access the bridlepath is through a gap to the left which has a large metal grid (old cattle grid? gate) lying on the ground which is lethal if a horse got its hoof caught in it. It is impossible to avoid. The is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckholt Road, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge dip in road, 20th June
item.description:
There is a big dip in the road outside number 50 upper park street on the turning point, it’s sinking rapidly and causing concern that it will be a big sink hole similar to a issue we had down this road a few months ago
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Upper Park Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
